Package com.clientwallet.validation

Class WalletIdValidator

java.lang.Object
com.clientwallet.validation.WalletIdValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidator<ValidWalletId,UUID>
public class WalletIdValidator extends Object implements jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidator<ValidWalletId,UUID>
Validator class for validating wallet IDs.

This class implements the ConstraintValidator interface to provide custom validation logic for wallet IDs, ensuring that the ID corresponds to an existing wallet in the system's database. It is used in conjunction with the ValidWalletId annotation.

The validator checks whether the provided wallet ID is not null and whether the wallet with that ID exists in the WalletRepository.

See Also:

  • WalletRepository

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(UUID walletId, jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidatorContext context)
      Validates if the given wallet ID is valid.

      This method checks if the wallet ID is not null and if the wallet with the given ID exists in the database. If the wallet does not exist, it will return false, meaning the validation fails.

      Specified by:
      isValid in interface jakarta.validation.ConstraintValidator<ValidWalletId,UUID>
      Parameters:
      walletId - The wallet ID to be validated.
      context - The context in which the constraint is applied. This can be used for more complex error reporting.
      Returns:
      True if the wallet ID exists in the database, otherwise false.
